p: After 22 days of treatment, we observed that the leaves of S. trilobata exposed to HT were greener than those of the control group (25 ± 1 °C). In contrast, S. calendulacea leaves exhibited an obvious yellow color under HT treatment, especially in the leaf base region ( Figure 1A). Compared with the control group, different trends were observed in the variations in photosynthetic pigments in the two Sphagneticola species under HT treatment. The chlorophyll a (Chl a), chlorophyll b (Chl b), total chlorophyll (Chl), carotenoids (Car), and chlorophyll a/b (Chl a/b) in the leaves of S. trilobata exposed to HT were all increased, while they decreased significantly in the leaves of S. calendulacea ( p < 0.01), coinciding with the leaf appearance ( Figure 1B–F).
